title: Ward 1: Etobicoke North
text: Not a big contest here. Generally Cristanti wins all over.

title: Ward 2: Etobicoke Centre
text: Holyday wins all over.

title: Ward 3: Etobicoke-Lakeshore
text: Generally Morley won the South of the riding, with more mixed results in the North-East and North-West. The apartments in Humber Bay shores are more mixed, with some leaning even towards Grimes.

title: Ward 4: Parkdale-High Park
text: Lhamo did much better in Parkdale, Perks in the High Park part of the riding. Agrell did well in the High Park part of the riding, but not well enough to earn her a place better than third.

title: Ward 5: York South-Weston
text: Generally a divide along the Kitchener GO train corridor, with Padovani doing better to the southwest and Nunziata doing better to the northeast.

title: Ward 6: York Centre
text: Pasternak pretty much wins big throughout.

title: Ward 7: Humber River-Black Creek
text: Generally Perruzza did well throughout, with less of a margin immediately west of highway 400.

title: Ward 8: Eglinton-Lawrence
text: Colle did well throughout. Sambasivam’s best area was just west of Yonge

title: Ward 9: Davenport
text: Bravo did well throughout.

title: Ward 10: Spadina-Fort York
text: Malik did best in a “ring” pattern, with the central part of the riding being more mixed and where Engelberg was strongest.

title: Ward 11: University-Rosedale
text: Saxe did best in the northeast: East Annex to Rosedale. Di Pasquale did best in the southwest.

title: Ward 12: Toronto-St. Paul’s
text: Matlow dominated this ward.

title: Ward 13: Toronto Centre
text: Moise did well in this ward throughout.

title: Ward 14: Toronto-Danforth
text: Fletcher did well in this ward throughout.

title: Ward 15: Don Valley West
text: Robinson did well throughout.

title: Ward 16: Don Valley East
text: Burnside did well throughout the ward, with some pockets on the west side having a lower margin of victory.

title: Ward 17: Don Valley North
text: Carroll did well throughout.

title: Ward 18: Willowdale
text: Cheng performed best east of Yonge and generally tied or had a slimmer margin to the west. O’Brien Fehr won a few pockets to the southwest and a few buildings here or there, but did not win many polls even on the west side of Yonge. Lee performed best in the north of the ward.

title: Ward 19: Beaches-East York
text: Bradford did well throughout.

title: Ward 20: Scarborough-Southwest
text: There was a north-south divide, where Kandavel did better south of the Lakeshore East train tracks and even better south of Kingston Road and Crawford did better to the north. Rupasinghe had the best showing from around Kennedy to the west border of the ward.

title: Ward 21: Scarborough Centre
text: Thompson did well throughout.

title: Ward 22: Scarborough-Agincourt
text: Nick Mantas did well throughout.

title: Ward 23: Scarborough North
text:
Ward 23 is a special case, as the incumbent councillor, Cynthia Lai, died a few days before the election. Her name remained on the ballot as they were already printed, but any votes for her were not counted. The first map is taking the official results, with any votes for Lai not counted. The second map uses a proxy for votes for Lai: total mayoral votes minus total votes for councillor.
In the official results map, Myers does well throughout the ward with a main gap surrounding Midland in the north.







Generally it seems like people knew that their vote for Lai would not be counted, though there are some pockets here and there where she got a quarter or more of the vote.

title: Ward 24: Scarborough-Guildwood
text: Paul Ainslie did well throughout.

title: Ward 25: Scarborough-Rouge Park
text: McKelvie did well throughout, but there are a few pockets where she tied or actually did a bit worse than Kanakaratnam.

title: 2022 Municipal Election Interactive Maps
text:
I decided to spend some time mapping out the poll-by-poll results for each of the council races. A lot of the races were not close so the maps just show a blowout.
Notes:
- I decided to arbitrarily include some candidates for some wards, based on endorsement by More Neighbours Toronto or just because I wanted to.
- The default map is the winner’s margin over the second place candidate overall, not in each poll.
- Legends are a bit of a mess, but you can clean them up by toggling on and off the different layers.
- You can toggle popular vote layers for certain candidates.
- For the poll (point) results, the size of the marker is the total number of votes cast, the shade is the percent point margin or percent popular vote.
